title: Strengthening Data Science Competencies: Blended Learning for Integrating Computational and Mathematical Thinking

context.prior_knowledge: Basic programming concepts (variables, conditionals, loops) and middle school-level mathematics (functions, logical operations)
context.additional_context: Advanced AI/machine learning technical course for AI/ML practitioners

learning_goals: When designing algorithms, learners can systematically decompose complex scientific problems by applying mathematical abstraction (functions, pattern recognition).
Learners can visualize mathematical modeling (graphs, equations) using block-based programming tools (Scratch, Python Tutor).
Through peer review, learners can analyze the complementary relationship between computational thinking (automation) and mathematical thinking (proof) in peers' problem-solving strategies.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
